effect.Name: Noise Blur (Switch)
effect.description: This effect uses noise to shift pixels, creating a pseudo blur.
effect.author: Foxioo

parameter.name: /* Foxioo Noise Blur (Switch) Shader | 1.0 (17.09.2025) */
parameter.description: This effect uses noise to shift pixels, creating a pseudo blur.

parameter.name: Blending Mode
parameter.description: This variable determines which color will be the basis for modification. Set to 0 means it will be the texture of the object and set to 1 it will be the background.

parameter.name: Mixing
parameter.description: This variable is responsible for the visibility of the effect.

parameter.name: Looping Mode!
parameter.description: This variable determines how the texture is to be looped: 0 - REPEAT (Repeats the texture image); 1 - MIRRORED REPEAT (Repeats the texture image, but reflects the image at each repetition); 2 - CLAMP TO EDGE (Extends the texture after crossing coordinates 0 and 1); 3 - CLAMP TO BORDER (After crossing coordinates 0 and 1, the texture will be invisible). For more information, visit: https://learnopengl.com/Getting-started/Textures

parameter.name: Seed
parameter.description: This variable is responsible for the randomness of the pattern, depending on the seed.

parameter.name: Dimension
parameter.description: This variable determines the degree of transition between only one direction for both dimensions or both directions for both dimensions. Range from 0 to 1.

parameter.name: Angle
parameter.description: This variable defines the angle for two-dimensional blurring in one direction.

parameter.name: ( Compatibility )
parameter.description: Here you will find options that have changed, but you can still achieve the previous effect.

parameter.name: Is Fusion Version Older Than 296?
parameter.description: (Only applies to Android and iOS!) This variable determines whether to use the newer background formatting. In Clickteam Fusion 2.5 for build 295.10 and earlier, the background texture was flipped along the Y axis, but this was changed in build 296.1. Check this option if you are using an older build!
